page.title: 17St. John's Church.
page.content: The parish of st. John's at Whorlton is a team church with St. Wilfred at Newbiggin Hall and Holy Nativity at Chapel House. There are about 21,000 people in the parish. The church is built of stone and there is a bell tower. The bell has fallen down but it used to ring to call people to service. The church roof is made of tiles. The vicar lives in the vicarage which is beside the church. Next to the church there is Church Cottage and next to it is the Church Hall where my sister goes to Sunday School. Sometimes the mummies meet there and they also use the hall as a Polling Station on election day. The Brownies and Guides use the hall too.
